result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Harcus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs & DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. Bond applied balance due during term of probation.
If physically able to work, maintain fulltime employment.
If successfully completes probation, eligible for 973.015 expungement option.

Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
20 days jail credit if revoked.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Participate in any counseling/assessments recommended by the agent.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Financial obligations are paid.
Court will make him eligible for Challenge and Substance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin R. Harcus

Discharge - Regular

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on August 16, 2016

Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in court with attorney David Paul Frank Templeton. Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:33 am Court calls the case.  Atty Cousins states the appearances.
This is set for a sentencing after revocation.

Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Templeton makes arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the sentence for 36 months - 18 months initial confinement and 18 months extended supervision.
102 days credit
Extended supervision conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Participate in any counseling/assessments recommended by the agent.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Pay any remainder of fine and court costs.
Court will make him eligible for Challenge and Substance.
This is a determinate sentence. 20 days to appeal case.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:41 a.m. Defendant Benjamin R. Harcus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF31 and 15CF130.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 15CF31 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 18 mo Prob: $200 + costs+ DNA surcharges.  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Maintain fulltime employment.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. If successfully completes probation, expungement option.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  15CF130 to be DRI.

Defendant enters a plea of:  15CF31: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF31 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  15CF31 Ct 2 and 15CF130 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs in part and requests no fulltime employment condition due to his disability. 20 days credit
